questions.question_text: Software Model Lifecycles can only be created for an external, publisher defined date.

discussion.content: B - False is the correct answer. SAM Fundamentals Utah - Internal lifecycle is used to track the date the software will no longer be available to request.

questions.question_text: Once a weekly software content update adds lifecycle data to your instance, can it be deleted from the software model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If a content update adds lifecycle data, it cannot be deleted from the software model but can be deactivated. Any lifecycle data that is added to a content update will have its source set to ServiceNow

choices.A: It can be deleted or deactivated
choices.C: It cannot unless the lifecycle stage is EOL

questions.question_text: During contract negotiations, what report could you run to gain visibility to products nearing end-of support?

comments.content:
Agreed, the closest answer would be B, but still, it's either Software Asset Workspace > License Usage > "Software product lifecycle report", which is the report they called "Software Lifecycle Report" (check sys_report.list).

Or... Software Asset Workspace > Software Asset Overview > "End of life products" reports.

discussion.content: None of these are correct, the correct answer would be Software Product Lifecycle Report. It can be checked just entering the License Workbench and looking to the Reports tab. I also recommend the following article: Although it talks about "Software Lifecycle Report", we can see that the internal name of the table is "sam_sw_product_lifecycle_report", so summarizing, the correct answer would be SOFTWARE PRODUCT LIFECYCLE REPORT"

Software Lifecycle Report
Get visibility to end-of-life and end-of-support software.

choices.C: Run the Software Model Lifecycle Report
choices.A: Manually set Allocations available on the entitlement to Zero (0)

questions.question_text: Once you are ready to retire software in ServiceNow, what is the critical first step in the retirement process?

discussion.content: B - "Once you have your EOL planning complete and you are ready to retire the software in ServiceNow, it is critical to expire the identified active software entitlements first, to ensure additional license rights cannot be allocated."

Selected Answer: B
From SAM Pro (Software Retirement): Once you have your EOL planning complete and you are ready to retire the software in ServiceNow, it is critical to expire the identified active software entitlements first, to ensure additional license rights cannot be allocated.

questions.question_text: Publisher information such as general availability and end-of-life dates will be provided as part of what feature within ServiceNow?

discussion.content: I think the C is answer

Looks like it is actually Software Product Lifecycle, but that is not an option.

As part of the Software Asset Management Content Library, content such as publisher general availability and end-of-life dates will be provided for software models that have been assigned a discovery map where software lifecycle content is available.
